alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 01 at 9:18AM PDT until November 01 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow above 2000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Jackson County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels through 11 am will be as low as 2000 feet with accumulation up to 1 inch. some light accumulations on roads may make travel difficult. The more significant accumulation will be above 3000 feet in the mountains. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
